Lost during conversion: There is a difference between openoffice and word in handling relative sizes: in openoffice the size can be set relative according to frame anchor (page, paragraph, character) but in word you can set size relativly to: page, margin, left margin and so on. So we can map only "size relative to page" property becouse the rest of properties  are incompatible.

There is a difference between openoffice and word in handling relative sizes: in openoffice the size can be set relative according to frame anchor (page, paragraph, character) but in word you can set size relativly to: page, margin, left margin and so on. So we can map only "size relative to page" property becouse the rest of properties  are incompatible.

Comments: This feature doesn't have a equivalent in Word (Word has different feature called "lock acpect ratio" but it works differently then "keep ratio" in OO. Openoffice "keep ratio" feature  doesn't block ratio - it justs calculates width and height)

There is no seperate property like anchor for frame/text-box in Word - it depends on value of "alignement relative to" property. In OpenOffice "anchor" and "alignment relative to" property are two different things.
